GROUNDMAX REMOVAL AND SNOW CLEARANCE AT NRC ROYAL MOUNT BUILDING
======================================================

Request for Proposal
-------------------

The National Research Council Canada (NRC) invites qualified contractors to submit a proposal for the provision of grounds maintenance and snow removal services at the NRC Royal Mount Building in Quebec, Canada.

### Tender Status

The tender has expired.

### Contract Details

This Request for Proposal calls for a contractor to provide grounds maintenance, snow and ice control, and waste operations services for the NRC Royal Mount Building in Quebec, Canada. The successful contractor will be responsible for providing services on all lands and campuses within the scope of the contract.

### Responsibilities

The contractor will be responsible for providing at its own cost all operational services. This includes:

* Grounds maintenance
* Snow removal and ice control
* Waste operations

The contractor will be responsible for any rehabilitation, damages or replacement costs resulting from the absence or lack of service and maintenance on the part of the contractor.

### Evaluation Criteria

The proposal will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

* Technical capability
* Financial resources
* Past experience and reputation

### Tender Documents

Tender documents are available on Merx.com or can be obtained by contacting the contracting authority.

### Contact

For more information, please contact Stephane Lajoie at [teluecomger@mr-ha cn.org](mailto:stephane.lajoie@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca). 

### Fee

There is no fee for tendering. Licenses and insurance requirements apply. 

### Special Requirements

Only qualified and eligible contractors may participate in this tender. Canada Trade Agreement references can be found on this website.

### Languages

English and French are official languages of the government of Canada.

Tender submissions must be made in English and French and in conformity with the tender documents.

### Tender Conditions
 The tenderer will be deemed to have accepted all the conditions set out in the tender documents.
